text: With a focus on good skin health, hydration and a brighter complexion, these are the best Korean beauty products to add to your routine. Product prices and offer details are not assured, and should be confirmed independently with the retailer. Learn more Korean beauty – also known as K-beauty – plays a huge part in the skincare and makeup world. Products you may use everyday – like BB cream and sheet masks – originated in the K-beauty market and it’s known for being incredibly innovative. While there are hundreds of K-beauty products available, they generally share three guiding principles; a laser focus on skin health, a commitment to providing maximum hydration and a goal of achieving the brightest and smoothest skin imaginable. You’ll also notice that K-beauty products are often formulated with natural ingredients where possible – think snail mucin (more on this later), green tea extracts, aloe vera and rice extracts. If you’re on the hunt for the best Korean beauty products to add to your skincare routine, we’ve found the most popular products based on positive customer reviews and ratings, and our own experience with the products, so you can be assured they work. Keep on scrolling to see what you should be adding to your Korean beauty shopping cart. BEST KOREAN BEAUTY PRODUCTS Cosrx Advanced Snail 96 Mucin Power Essence, Amazon Australia, $38 Could you ever imagine putting snail mucin on your face as part of your skincare routine? Turns out people do, and over 12,000 Amazon customers can vouch for it. Snails are known for their ability to recover themselves when injured. So Cosrx have decided to apply this same concept to our skin – without harming any snails in the process. Snail mucin offers relief to troubled skin and replenishes moisture in a dehydrated complexion. Originating from South Korea, the power essence promises to offer a lightweight, non-greasy texture that’s easily absorbed into the skin. Five-star Amazon reviewers have said it’s “amazing” and “I noticed my skin looks hydrated and has the classic glass skin look.” SHOP HERE Some By Mi 30 Days Miracle Toner, iHerb, $28.28 If you’re looking for a product that’s going to completely transform the look of your skin, you’re going to want to incorporate an exfoliator into your routine. The Some By Mi Miracle Toner is a gentle chemical exfoliant that uses the power of AHA, BHA, PHA and niacinamide. All of these ingredients work together to brighten skin tone and texture, remove dead skin cells, balance oil production and reduce the appearance of blemishes. It’s racked up over 6,000 five-star customer ratings on iHerb. One user wrote, “I have read a lot of good reviews so I decided to try it out and I’m so happy to prove that it does live up to it’s reputation.” SHOP HERE Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask, Adore Beauty, $28 There’s a good chance you’ve seen the Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask somewhere on your Instagram or TikTok feed. It’s loved by many – it has an average rating of 4.6 stars from an enormous 54,000 Google reviews – so you know you’re getting bang for your buck when it comes to this lip balm. Described as being an “absolute holy grail product”, the Lip Sleeping Mask promises to keep your lips moisturised, plumped and hydrated while you sleep. But don’t let the name fool you, many users apply this balm during the day too. It’s a thick balm that feels super luxurious on application, plus we love the fact that it comes in a range of delicious flavours – think berry, vanilla, mint choc and more. SHOP HERE Klairs Freshly Juiced Vitamin Drop, Amazon Australia, $39 If you want nothing more than brighter skin, you may want to try the Klairs Freshly Juiced Vitamin Drop Serum. It’s formulated with a stabilised and pure concentration of vitamin C to brighten the complexion, hydrate and reduce the appearance of pigmentation and dark spots. It’s racked up over 4,800 five-star ratings on Amazon, with many leaving comments that it helped them achieve “glowing skin”. SHOP HERE Cosrx Acne Pimple Master Patch, iHerb, $5 Say goodbye to your pimples overnight with these genius patches from trusted brand Cosrx. Over 21,000 iHerb customers have given this product the five-star tick of approval, so what have you got to lose? It’s formulated with hydrocolloid which works to absorb excess oil and actually extract the pimple from your skin. It’s fast acting and non-drying, plus we love the fact that the patch also works as a protective cover – so you won’t be tempted to pick at your spots. SHOP HERE Dr. Jart+ Dermask Micro Jet Brightening Solution Sheet Mask, Oz Hair & Beauty, $8.60 Get ready to sit back, relax and let this Dr Jart+ sheet mask do all the work for you. The Brightening Solution Mask is made with a combination of active ingredients to penetrate deep into your skin and provide you with a plethora of brightening effects. It’s packed with antioxidants, glutathione, niacinamide and a-bisabol to brighten, hydrate and reduce the appearance of pigmentation and dark spots. SHOP HERE Innisfree Green Tea Seed Serum, Adore Beauty, $39 Allow your skin to experience the magic of green tea extracts, all thanks to Innisfree. If your skin is feeling dry, dehydrated and a little lack lustre, give the Green Tea Seed Serum a red-hot go. It offers loads of moisturising, plumping and hydrating benefits by penetrating deep into your skin to give you that glass skin look. We love that it promises to improve your skin’s moisture barrier, as that is a factor that’s key in Korean beauty. Avoiding a compromised moisture barrier is the solution to preventing moisture loss and improving the speed at which your skin heals. SHOP HERE The Face Shop Jeju Aloe Fresh Soothing Gel, Amazon Australia, $12.90 We all know how amazing aloe vera works on sunburnt skin – well, let’s take that same context and apply it to our face. Formulated with 99 per cent aloe vera leaf extract, this soothing gel is designed to moisturise dehydrated skin and calm irritation and redness. It’s a fast-absorbing formula that applies to the skin without that annoying sticky feeling, so it’s perfect for use on your face. Sure you can use this gel cream on sunburnt skin, but it doesn’t have to be limited to just that. Use it any time you feel like your face needs a little extra TLC. SHOP HERE Klairs Freshly Juiced vitamin E Mask, Amazon Australia, $38.90 Don’t let the name fool you – the Klairs Freshly Juiced Vitamin E Mask does not have to actually be used as a mask. I trialled this product myself, using it as my daytime moisturiser and I absolutely fell in love with it. If you’re longing for glossy skin, this is the product for you. It’s formulated with vitamin C and vitamin E to drastically improve the appearance of your skin. You’re left with a smooth, hydrated and brighter complexion, and who doesn’t want that? SHOP HERE Cosrx Low pH Good Morning Gel Cleanser, iHerb, $12 On the hunt for a basic cleanser that actually cleans your skin without it feeling super dry and tight? Introducing the Good Morning Gel Cleanser from Cosrx. The formulation offers a bunch of botanical skin-purifying ingredients to clean your skin and make it feel soft and supple – yes, even those with sensitive skin types. It’s racked up over 9,900 five-star customer ratings on the iHerb site, with many saying it’s an “excellent” cleanser that’s “very gentle”. SHOP HERE Innisfree Super Volcanic Pore Clay Mask, Adore Beauty, $22 If it feels like your pores are completely taking over your face, you may want to introduce this clay mask to your routine. The Innisfree Super Volcanic Mask is a best-selling formulation, using the power of Jeju Super Volcanic Clusters and AHAs to deeply cleanse and exfoliate the skin. It promises to minimise the look of pores and absorb excess oil, leaving you with a smooth and clear complexion. SHOP HERE I’M From Rice Toner, Amazon Australia, $46 The I’M From Rice Toner has been described as being an “amazing” product and I can see why. I’ve been trialling the power of Yeoju rice extracts and I can vouch for its ability to brighten and moisturise the skin. For starters, I love the lightweight formulation – it’s a super watery consistency that dries down and absorbs into the skin quite quickly. It offers unique benefits to your skin’s protective barrier, preventing water loss and balancing both dry and dehydrated skin. SHOP HERE Saturday Skin Wide Awake Brightening Eye Cream, Sephora, $78 Brighten your dull and dehydrated under eye area with the Wide Awake Cream from Saturday Skin. It’s racked up close to 700 five-star ratings on the Sephora website, with many describing it being “lightweight” and “super effective”. Another K-Beauty product I’ve actually tried myself, I can’t help but agree with all of these statements. It’s formulated with date seed extracts which offer a unique illuminating effect around the under eye. In order to provide the skin with hydration, Saturday Skin have included avocado protein extract, hyaluronic acid and a patented peptide complex. SHOP HERE Sulwhasso First Care Activating Serum, Sephora, $119 If you’re keen to try something a little different from the world of K-Beauty, I recommend the Sulwhasso First Care Activating Serum. It’s not the sort of product you’ll find in the western beauty market. The serum is designed to act as a prepping serum in your routine – you apply it straight after you finish cleansing. The formulation promises to hydrate, nourish and tighten the skin, all while boosting the absorption of all the products you choose to apply on top. The JAUM Balancing Complex™ is a potent combination of five Korean herbs to help you get that dewy glass skin we all know and love. SHOP HERE WHAT DOES A KOREAN SKINCARE ROUTINE LOOK LIKE?
